Nope, they'll be kept open. But that is a thought though. Having the option=

(while paused) to close all ARC files and (upon resume) create new ones
wo=
uld be a good idea. I'll add an RFE for that.

As for moving the ARC files.=
.. Any file that hasn't changed in the last 20
to 30 minutes should be clos=
ed. Generally the X files (X being equal to the
number of ARC files in the =
ARC pool) with the latest change time should be
the only ones being activel=
y used.

- Kris
